Poor.title: Immediate Sleep Hygiene Review Needed
Poor.description: Your responses indicate significant difficulties with sleep. This can affect your mood, energy, and overall health. It is highly recommended to prioritize sleep hygiene immediately.

tips.title: Establish a Routine
tips.description: Go to bed and wake up at the same time every day, even on weekends.

tips.title: Consult a Professional
tips.description: Since you are experiencing significant sleep issues, consider speaking with a healthcare provider to rule out sleep disorders.

tips.title: Limit Screen Time
tips.description: Avoid screens (phones, tablets, computers) for at least one hour before bed. The blue light interferes with melatonin production.

tips.title: Create a Sleep Sanctuary
tips.description: Ensure your bedroom is dark, quiet, and cool. Consider using earplugs or an eye mask if needed.

Fair.title: Room for Improvement
Fair.description: You are getting some rest, but there are clear signs that your sleep quality or quantity could be better.

tips.title: Consistency is Key
tips.description: Try to stick to a consistent sleep schedule to help regulate your body's internal clock.

tips.title: Watch Your Caffeine
tips.description: Avoid caffeine in the afternoon and evening. Its effects can last for several hours.

tips.title: Relaxation Techniques
tips.description: Try deep breathing or progressive muscle relaxation before bed to calm your mind.

Good.title: Great Sleep Habits
Good.description: You seem to be sleeping well! Maintaining these good habits is important for long-term health.

tips.title: Maintain Your Routine
tips.description: Keep doing what you are doing! Consistency is the most important factor.

tips.title: Exercise Regularly
tips.description: Regular physical activity can help you fall asleep faster and enjoy deeper sleep.

Excellent.title: Sleep Master
Excellent.description: Your sleep hygiene is exemplary. You are likely reaping the benefits of good rest in your daily life.

tips.title: Spread the Word
tips.description: Your habits are working well. Consider helping friends or family who might struggle with sleep.

tips.title: Listen to Your Body
tips.description: Even with great habits, if you ever feel tired, don't hesitate to take a short power nap (20 mins).
